column4: What should happen when my machine gets hot? Should it just hang on me?
It does so by using less resources...
Ubuntu does not put as much of a load on the system as Windows does, so because of that, the system runs cooler
Not on my machine...
What problem are you having?
When running my system hard, it will blank the screen and hang
Pastebin the specs of your system
Is there a command or do I type them up myself?
Just type them up yourself
Anything in particular I should add?
I just need the CPU clock speed, hard drive capacity and used space, RAM capacity and used space, and video card type
http://paste2.org/p/490104
Is this a laptop?
Yes. HP 6735b
And what are you doing that eats up so many resources?
Various things. Gaming can do it, installing Ubuntu server in a desktop while surfing the web and playing flash games has done it, compiling does it
There's your problem.  Your laptop's video card is not designed for gaming
But compiling doesn't use my gpu....
The gaming does, though
I can live with that, but is there a way to improve my system's heat management?
The only way is to stop using the high-demand applications
Under Windows and Jaunty there was much less of a problem
